input: user: Depict the crowning of a new monarch.
output:
Kingly office doth now shine with sovereign light,
Before our throng, most noble crown ye shall bring hight.

Nay lesser glints with gilded mantle dare not claim,
But thou alone dost wear it as befits thy fame.

In halls where majesty doth most abounds and prests,
A solemn silence fills the hearts of all who rest

Within thy presence. Thou art crowned with virtue's might
By all our people's eyes this crowning glows, now quite nigh.

With brawn aloft in hand doth the longbowed herald stand,
Thou to our king is now anointed, his majesty renowned.

Now crown of sovereignty shall hang o'er thee, King anew.
And with it rings our praises of eternal trust and true.
complianceText:
The chatbot output complies with the description of speaking in a Shakespearean style. The text uses archaic and stylized language reminiscent of Shakespeare's works. Words such as "doth," "thou," "thee," and "hath" are present, which are characteristic of Shakespearean English. The structure and rhythm of the passage reflect poetic elements, similar to examples found in Shakespearean writing. There is no indication or requirement of the original input to evaluate this stylistic compliance. 

No violation.
